about.title: About
about.intro:
Hi, my name is Olivier! With over 2 years of experience as a Front-end Developer in Canada, I have designed applications with Angular for 7 real estate agencies and created 8 custom WordPress themes. I am currently seeking an apprenticeship to start training in Full-stack development.

I am already proficient in Angular, as well as technologies like JavaScript, HTML, SCSS, and PHP, allowing me to develop efficient applications and interfaces. I am excited to join a team where I can apply my skills while learning new technologies and working methods. My goal is to optimize user experience and bring real value to your project.

projects.title: Station SME (Student Mental Health)
projects.excerpt:
I independently developed the Station SME website, a platform dedicated to student mental health, using WordPress. The project integrates Twig for templating, PHP for routing and hooks, as well as JavaScript and Sass for styling and animations.


Challenges:

  • • Create an attractive site with smooth animations that is fully customizable by the client.
  • • Implement advanced search with AddSearch to allow users to quickly find information across all posts.

projects.title: Donovan Team
projects.excerpt:
For the Donovan Team site, I developed a website for a Quebec real estate agency using Angular with Sass styles, as part of the e-closion solution provided by Kryzalid in Montreal. This site combines customization and modularity to meet the specific needs of the client while adhering to the e-closion structure.


Challenges:

  • • Creating a unique site reflecting the client's image while maintaining consistency with the e-closion solution structure.
  • • Continuously improving the e-closion solution to better meet the specific needs of real estate agencies.

projects.title: Contest Management Platform for the University of Montreal
projects.excerpt:
For the University of Montreal, I co-developed a contest platform using Vue.js and Laravel via Inertia. This application allows students to view available contests, register online, and track their current or past registrations.


Challenges:

  • • Validating contest statuses to display relevant information (open, ongoing, closed).
  • • Managing the student journey: submission and validation of documents related to each contest.

projects.title: Via Prévention
projects.excerpt:
For Via Prévention, I designed a customizable website on WordPress, allowing the client to easily manage their content. The project integrates PHP for routing, hooks, and database calls, Twig for templating, as well as JavaScript and Sass for dynamic animations. The site also supports ordering training sessions and documents, with an automated order form creation.


Challenges:

  • • Creating an engaging, colorful, and customizable site according to the client's needs.
  • • Online ordering functionality for training sessions and documents, including an automated order form generation system.
